summary: Simplify TypeScript project structure by consolidating multiple tsconfig files into a single configuration now that workflow code is bundled with Webpack, trading some type safety for better developer experience and reduced complexity.
userImpact: Developers benefit from a simpler single tsconfig setup while needing to be more careful about accidentally using non-deterministic APIs in workflows.
rootCause: The composite project structure with multiple tsconfigs is unnecessarily complex now that Webpack handles workflow bundling and can output CommonJS.
proposedFix: Consolidate the 4 tsconfig files into a single configuration, update samples and documentation to reflect the new structure.
resolutionDetails: The project structure was simplified by consolidating multiple TypeScript configuration files into a single configuration as agreed upon in the discussion.
keyQuote: instead of 4 tsconfig files we can now have a single config file. Doing this means sacrificing some type safety
